DOC.brief_summary: Introduction : Preterm labor ( PTL ) important obstetric intercurrence affect 5 10 % pregnancy . Among known factor PTL etiology PTL occurrence previous pregnancy , multiple pregnancy , polyhydramnios , vaginal bleeding pregnancy , premature membrane rupture ( PMR ) bacterial vaginosis . Despite advancement achieve Neonatology , morbidity mortality result high rate preterm birth remain constant last decade . Objective : This study aim evaluate maternal perinatal outcome pregnant woman history preterm labor previous pregnancy submit active search vaginal infection . Material Method : It prospective-cohort epidemiological study conduct Botucatu/SP . Two study group ( G1 G2 ) form , comprise 140 pregnant woman history preterm childbirth . G1 relate active search etiological diagnosis lower genital tract infection , G2 relate non-search infection , routine care protocol primary health unit city Botucatu maintain . Care propedeutics pregnant woman ( G1 ) include performance direct examination vaginal content stain Gram method , culture Diamonds medium , polymerase chain reaction ( PCR ) endocervical secretion collect primary health care service city two moment : prior 20th gestational week ( M1 ) 36th week ( M2 ) . Moment M3 take place childbirth evaluation perinatal outcome .
DOC.brief_title: Maternal Perinatal Outcome Women With History Premature Labor Previous Pregnancy
DOC.criteria: Will include study woman history preterm labor previous pregnancy , without risk factor identify initial prenatal current initiate prenatal care 20 week gestation unit primary care Botucatu agree participate . Will exclude study woman complication pregnancy urinary tract infection , severe periodontal disease , hypertension , diabetes multiple gestation , among others .
